reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very addicting read
reviews.reviewText: I have to say that in the last 20 years, my only reading has been non-fiction. I am overjoyed to have found this series of light novels. I do not enjoy manga all that much because of the way it seems to jump around and I tend to get easily lost and have to reread it a couple of times before I get the jist of things (not dumb just too easily distracted). There are not too many animes I will watch, in this case I found too many of them are just not that interesting. So I can name the ones I do like on 2 hands. My son knowing my tastes occasionally gives me names of anime to watch, I have a CrunchyRoll paid account that I rarely use. So, after binge watching The Apothecary Diaries and knowing that they are just being released now to the U.S., I actually went looking for the manga so that I could keep on with the story, even though it is not my favorite way of reading. When I found it, I also found the light novels and immediately bought up the first 10 of them about 4-5 days ago. I am already through book 4 and felt it was necessary to post a review.So, the story revolves around a young girl, Maomao, who was raised by an apothecary and when growing up learned all about medicines and how to use them. When she is kidnapped and sold to the palace to work in the rear palace, where the concubines and their servants live, she tries to keep her head down vowing to work off the two years as a lowly servant. But she cannot help but get involved when she sees that the emperors two new children are dying a slow death and she knows why.The story is really quite fun to read, especially since she just can't let something go that has her curiosity awaken or that she has the knowledge to make better. One of the reviewers mentioned that sometimes the descriptive words used were just weird. There were moments in the story when I was a bit confused as to what they were trying to say. But I found just moving forward into the story resolved those moments of confusion. After 4 books I have to say that I can't put it them down. I am looking forward to the rest of the anime and I really hope that they make all of it. My only suggestion is to watch a few of the episodes before starting on the books so that you have the images in your mind to go along with the story. Like I said, it is on CrunchyRoll and I remember at one time they had a free version and you just had to watch commercials.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Interesting Story with Courtly Intrigue and Great Chatacters
reviews.reviewText: One of my favorite animes of this season is based on this light novel. And even though I have just watched this story, it was still a good read. The story itself is not much different than the anime maybe a few details here and there. It looks like the first season or 12 episodes of the anime all come from this first light novel. Which means there will be much more story to discover once the anime is complete.I enjoy this story for several reasons. I like the intrigue that the court aspect brings, and it never goes where you think it’s going to go. I love the characters too. Maomao is such an unusual girl. Smart and worldly but at the same time very naive. I love her. I also adore Jinshi. There has got to be more to him than we know so far. He’s too complex to be someone who overseas part of the rear palace as it is called. The tertiary characters aren’t completely flat either, they have some personality and really fill n the story. It’s well written and well throughout so far. I can’t wait read what will happen next.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: So by the time I realized there were light novels, I had already watched all of season one that had been released just recently. And seeing as how I loved the show- I immediately picked this up. I’m already beginning the second one now! If anyone is wondering or is like me and came from watching the anime first, this book is the entirety of season one. Not sure if that’s common knowledge or common sense, but this is the first light novel I have ever read. And I think the anime did a really good job of including everything from the LN in the show. But really love this so far. Will be reading more. And the illustrations throughout the book are very nice as well. Highly recommend 💜

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Loved it! These novels are a joy to read. I love that they are a slow burn romance filled with comedy and mystery. I can't wait to read what comes next!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars for the love of maomao
reviews.reviewText: A story about maomao an apothecary who is kidnapped and sold to the palace. She solves mysteries and works her way up to the rear palace. In this story there always seems to be something going on so there aren’t any lulls & the characters are fantabulous.Now on to my biased opinion. I absolutely adore this series. The show & manga are both 10/10 so I decided I needed to get my hands on the light novel. They do give a little more information than the other two (bc it’s a novel duh) and there are so many insights into more than just maomaos thoughts that are lacking in the other 2 forms. Definitely worth checking out if you love this story.I gave it a 4 star bc there were some moments where the descriptive words used were just weird. I’m guessing maybe a translation thing? Not a big deal I just went “oh okay” and kept it pushing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: As someone who started reading the manga right after watching the first 3 episodes, I had to pick up the light novel. It's so detailed and truly a different experience. I can't wait to read the next one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: If you like the anime, this is definitely worth the read! It's also nice to get some more details about Jinchi and Maomao's thoughts and desires behind their actions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Such a great read. The anime follows it perfectly and really helps give life to the imagery the author details in writing. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It wants to read more for a long time, when you read one peace you want to read it all in one go

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I tried the Manga for this series first and found I enjoyed it, and same could be said of the LN though for different reasons. Either way it was enjoyable to read and I look forward to the rest of the series.

Traduction anglaise d'excellente qualité, le roman se lit tout seul pour peu qu'on ai un bon niveau d'anglais !Histoire très intéressante, ce premier volume donne définitivement envie de lire la suite pour continuer de suivre les aventures de Maomao !
Its an intreaging plot and a cute romance and I cannot wait to see how it develops in the following volumes.

reviews.reviewTitle: fun, exciting and full of character
reviews.reviewText: Love this story. The characters are well thought out and likeable. The story is interesting and fun. Maomao is a fun and intelligent protagonist. Def recommend.
